explanation: The first part of section 4 states that CONSULTANT cannot endorse PRODUCT made or sold by any other manufacturer or seller, however, in section 4D, it states that the CONSULTANT shall be entitled to endorse and play the [*****].

Section 4D states If [*****] use of CONSULTANT varies from past practice of utilizing similarly situated professionals, CONSULTANT will take action to remedy the situation [*****]. which does not make sense structurally.

In section 5, it is stated that CONSULTANT shall exclusively play/use the MANDATORY PRODUCT whenever practical. The decision on whether to use the MANDATORY PRODUCT in a specific tournament will be at the sole discretion of the CONSULTANT based on performance considerations. (It is expressly understood by the parties that CONSULTANT may play [* ****] clubs in the bag other than ADAMS GOLF clubs including, but not limited to, a putter by a manufacturer other than ADAMS GOLF but may not endorse those clubs and/or putter.) which is contradictory.
